paper.title: Collision-free accumulators and fail-stop signature schemes without trees
paper.venue: Theory and Application of Cryptographic Techniques
paper.abstract: One-way accumulators, introduced by Benaloh and de Mare, can be used to accumulate a large number of values into a single one, which can then be used to authenticate every input value without the need to transmit the others. However, the one-way property does is not sufficient for all :[49],"this paper, we generalize the definition of accumulators and define and construct a collision-free subtype. As an application, we construct a fail-stop signature scheme in which many one-time public keys are accumulated into one short public key. In contrast to previous constructions with tree authentication, the length of both :[49],"this public key and the signatures can be independent of the number of messages that can be signed.
